intro: Stenomesson cuzcoense, commonly known as the Cuzco morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Peru. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant produces tendrils that help it climb and twine around other vegetation. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its flowers range in color from pale blue to violet. Stenomesson cuzcoense is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
